pr_title: NXP-29978: add support for idempotency key in request controller filter

timeline.message: NXP-29978: add support for idempotency key in request controller filter

timeline.bodyText: Could we use something more generic, like Idempotency-Key or X-Idempotency-Key maybe?
timeline.author: BoboTiG

replies.bodyText: Of course, I was not sure if we wanted this header to be Nuxeo-specific so i just went with this value for now
replies.author: atchertchian

replies.bodyText: I moved the key in the code but we should still discuss naming, so keeping this conversation open
replies.author: atchertchian

replies.bodyText: Idempotency-Key is good it's what's in the draft RFC and used by lots of organizations already.
replies.author: efge

timeline.bodyText:
https://github.com/paypal/api-standards/blob/master/patterns.md#idempotency explains that should return HTTP 200 + the result.
When it is a new request, it should return HTTP 201  + the result.
I am not familiar with the code here, does that return such HTTP codes?
timeline.author: BoboTiG

replies.bodyText:
I went with conflict because that's what's documented here https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-idempotency-header-01.
As for 201, this filter cannot know this is for creation so not sure 201 applies here, and the code is left unchanged compared to a request that would go through without idempotency.
replies.author: atchertchian

replies.bodyText:
Conflict seems the good error to throw.
200 or 201, I would say this is fine as-is. As soon as this is not an error code :)
replies.author: BoboTiG

replies.bodyText:
Well it will be an error code if there's indeed an error while processing the request.
That's also why we may want the code to be stored too when the request is processed, so that is can be returned again in case a request with the same key has already gone through.
replies.author: atchertchian

replies.bodyText: Hmm how would you make the difference between an HTTP 500 error and a "valid" error like a 404? The 500 error should not be cached as another call may unlock the real result. And a 404 now may not be revelant 2 minutes later. Same for 401 and 403 errors for example.
replies.author: BoboTiG

replies.bodyText: Ok so maybe the code should be checked before storing the result, and key removed from the store in this case?
replies.author: atchertchian

replies.bodyText: I changed the processing so that in case of error, store content is nullified for this key
replies.author: atchertchian

timeline.bodyText: 5 minutes seems quite small, no?
timeline.author: BoboTiG

replies.bodyText: I put a (quite) low TTL for testing, we can set a better default value indeed.
replies.author: atchertchian

replies.bodyText: I moved these values but we should still discuss the default value for TTL
replies.author: atchertchian

replies.bodyText: The base default should be at least one day I think. Some organizations use 30 days as TTL!
replies.author: efge

replies.bodyText: We should activate the filter for all methods except GET/HEAD/OPTIONS/TRACE, which are the "safe methods" per RFC 7231 §4.2.1, and PUT/DELETE which are the "idempotent methods" per RFC 7231 §4.2.2. So in practice it's mostly POST yes, but maybe we use the RFC list instead to be clean.

Also javax.ws.rs.HttpMethod declares these as constants, except TRACE, so not sure the full list is already available somewhere else?

See what NuxeoCorsCsrfFilter does for the constants.

timeline.bodyText: How come? There should be no async jobs involved here, and I guess the transaction should always have been committed when getting  the answer from createDocument @kevinleturc?
timeline.author: ataillefer

replies.bodyText:
The rest query API (used to count children) relies on the page provider REST_API_SEARCH_ADAPTER, using ElasticSearch and not the CoreSession, hence the need for this to avoid random failures.
Note i needed this trick in Explorer ftests too, so i think this whole method would be useful on the RestHelper API.
replies.author: atchertchian

replies.bodyText:
And just to answer the fact that this would be needed to get the document id after creation: it's not.
I'm just following a test pattern where the async jobs should be waited for after the action triggering them, as shutting down the test server while async jobs are still running is also exposing tests to random failures, with errors in logs, typically.
replies.author: atchertchian
